mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mathematics
mods:titleInfo.mods:subTitle: what are you teaching my child?

mods:physicalDescription.mods:extent: 1 videodisc : sd., col. with b&w sequences ; 4 3/4 in.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: "Burns orients viewers to the continually changing world of math instruction and the ways in which these changes will benefit students. Woven throughout the video are scenes of classroom instruction, interviews with parents about their own math schooling, and visits with professionals using math in real-world contexts."--Math Solutions Web site.
mods:mods.mods:note: "This program was developed by Scholastic Inc. in cooperation with Cuisenaire Company of America, Inc. and Marilyn Burns Education Associates.";Originally produced in 1994.;"A DVD for parents and educators"--Container.
DVD.

mods:physicalDescription.mods:extent: 3 videodiscs (90 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in. +1 CD-ROM (4 3/4 in.).

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Marilyn Burns models ways for teachers to gain insights into students' understanding about mathematics.
mods:mods.mods:tableOfContents: Disc 1. Shows interviews with children ages 7 through 9 and focuses on their number sense and understanding of place value. Disc 2. Focuses on 10-year-old students' ability to estimate, reason numerically, and compute with whole numbers in proble-solving situations. Disc 3. Deals with fractions and features an in-depth look at one 12-year-old's process of thinking and reasoning.
mods:mods.mods:note: CD-ROM contains a teacher discussion guide.
DVD-R.

mods:physicalDescription.mods:extent: 3 videodiscs (72 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in. +1 CD-ROM.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Three-part series showing math lessons in grades 6, 7, and 8 on fractions, percents, algebra, ratio and proportion, area, perimeter, angle measurement, probability, and statistics. Disc 1: explores the role of the student, the importance of incorporating student communication about math into all classroom lessons, and the benefits of having students explain their thinking and reasoning. Disc 2: explores the role of the teacher, including the structure of lessons, setting up cooperative work groups, and homework assignments. Disc 3: explores the role of the content, including selection/organization of content of lessons, using manipulatives, and integrating math skills instead of teaching isolated skills.
mods:mods.mods:note: Originally produced in 1989.;These discs are recorded DVDs and may not play on all DVD players or drives.;Accompanying CD-ROM titled "Comprehensive Discussion Guide", contains overviews, questions for teacher discussions, suggestions for pre-service and in-service use of the videos, detailed analysis of the lessons presented, printable worksheets, etc.;"A three part DVD series for grades 6-8 staff development"--Discs and container.
Directors of photography, Michael Anderson, Bill Zarchy ; editor, Terry Kane Chinn ; music, Jim Purchell.
Host/narrator, Marilyn Burns ; commentary, Marilyn Burns ; teachers, Marilyn Burns, Ruth Cossey, Cathy McLaughlin.
DVD-R.

mods:physicalDescription.mods:extent: 3 videodiscs (82 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in. +1 CD-ROM.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Shows how to implement the NCTM Standards for teaching students K-6 to value mathematics, solve problems, reason, and communicate, while increasing confidence in their math abilities. Disc 1: models teacher-directed, whole-class lessons. Disc 2: shows the same classes working independently in small groups on a menu of activities organized around a particular mathematical focus, often continuations of activities introduced in whole class lessons. Disc 3: shows how communicating both verbally and in writing in math lessons support children's learning and help teachers assess student's understanding.
mods:mods.mods:tableOfContents: [disc 1] Whole class lessons (29 min.) -- [disc 2] Menus. Introducing the menus ; Working on the menus ; Whole class discussion (24 min.) -- [disc 3] Communication (29 min.).
mods:mods.mods:note: Originally produced in 1992.;These discs are recorded DVDs and may not play on all DVD players or drives.;Accompanying CD-ROM titled "Comprehensive Discussion Guide", contains overviews, questions for teacher discussions, suggestions for pre-service and in-service use of the videos, detailed analysis of the lessons presented, blackline masters, etc.;"A staff development DVD series"--Container.
Directors of photography, Michael Anderson, Bill Zarchy ; editor, Marilyn Heiss ; original music, Jerry Gerber.
Host/narrator, Marilyn Burns ; teachers, Carol Brooks, Judy Darcy, Olga Torres.
DVD-R.

mods:mods.mods:tableOfContents: Math is fun? -- Fat triangles & flattened bagels -- Cool curves -- A roomful of right triangles -- Math in music -- Pachinko math -- GCF-LCM machine -- Baumkuchen, spaghetti & watermelon -- Automat(h) -- A slice of a cone -- Paper twists -- Fold and cut -- Jigsaws from tetrahedrons -- Single & double duty solids -- Reversible solids --All the way home.
mods:mods.mods:note: Includes bibliographical references.
mods:mods.mods:accessCondition: Access restricted to authorized users and institutions.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: For whole-class use, preferably on an interactive white board, that will support several lessons. Teachers should view the programmes Just a Fraction and Understanding Fractions and the associated web materials before beginning.Making a Start: Introduces the resources and maths tables. Addition, Subtraction and Equals: The cups are used. Quarters are introduced. Maths Story/Real Story: The link between the maths story, a calculation on paper and the real story, illustrated by manipulating paper cups, is shown. In the second part, students should write out the maths story as they see the real story acted out.Multiplication: The idea of using an action to differentiate between addition and multiplication is introduced. More Fractions: The link between the concrete representation of cups and the symbolic representation with cards is established.Moving Multiplication On: Cards are used to act a real story Imagining Cups: Manipulating fractions in your head.
mods:mods.mods:note: Title from resource description page (viewed Mar. 5, 2012).
Previously released as DVD.
Electronic reproduction.Alexandria, VA :Alexander Street Press,2012.(Education in video).Available via World Wide Web.
